JobFullDesc: Microsoft Cloud Operations + Innovation is the team behind the cloud. CO+I is responsible for delivering over 200 Microsoft web portals, Live and Online Services around the world including infrastructure, security and compliance, data center operations, globalization, and manageability. Our focus is on smart growth, high efficiency, and delivering a trusted experience to customers and partners worldwide. We are looking for a passionate, high energy individual to help build the network that powers the world’s largest online services. The Infrastructure, Planning and Acquisition Center of Excellence team is responsible for enabling and optimizing the foundation that supports delivery of data center capacity through efficient processes, data driven decision making, innovation, automated and integrated tool sets.    As a Process Engineer, you will partner with business process owners across the organization to identify and execute process improvements with the aim of driving stability and reduction in process variations and associated key cycle time metrics. You will be responsible for identifying, coaching, and training process champions across teams and develop process capability roadmaps for growing and maturing the organizational process practice. Additionally, you will be responsible for measuring and communicating the project impacts in partnership with the team leads and process owners. In this role, you will also partner with cross-functional teams such as Engineering and Azure OneBPM to deliver capability development projects.#coicareersResponsibilitiesEngage with business stakeholders to document end to end business processes, workflows, runbooks and generate standardized process maps using standardized industry templates preferably BPMN.Drive business process analysis using industry tools like SIPOC, FMEA, 8D, Fishbone, Cause effect analysis etc. to proactively identify, document, prioritize and align on process improvement opportunities.Partner and coach process champions across teams to establish, grow and standardize process excellence practice. Create process capability roadmaps to support org’s process maturity journey and drive alignment with technology roadmaps.Establish process and technology metrics for regular maturity assessment and improvements.Demonstrate data driven strategies to expand connected enterprise automation capabilities through cross functional process and technology projects.Translate ideas into reality by writing high quality specs that cover end-to-end customer scenarios, and drive for results throughout the process .Work closely with engineers, partners, and stakeholders to gather and prioritize requirements and ensure alignment on scenarios.Listen and learn directly from customers and through customer data to ensure we’re making correct decisions each step of the way.Managing schedules, risks, and issues and communicating them effectively to the team, management, and partners.Create strategy and technology roadmap by collaborating with the team, product and design partners. Communication – clear and concise communication skills, both written and verbal.  #coicareersQualificationsBA/BS Degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline, or 4+ years of related professional experience.Six Sigma Green Belt certification from an internal entity or a globally recognized third-party.
